posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked:
Currently to my knowledge it is not possible to pin a message in a chat or a group chat to the top so it stays visible for everybody. This could be handy especially for groups if you want to remind group members of something, so they dont lose the message.

This could be displayed right underneath the info bar with name and profile picture, using a little pin to indicate that the message is pinned.

For reference: Telegram has a feature like this and WhatsApp just announced it in their latest release in the AppStore.

pinned-telegram-2950821368720×278 25.1 KB

This is how it is done in Telegram, which is a pretty handy solution I think. Py tipping on the pinned message you jump to the message in the group or chat, and can see the full-size version of it.

link_counts.title: A forum category is a mediocre way to track feature requests

posts.cooked: WhatsApp have just started to roll that out in groups in the latest update on the App Store

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked: Yep, and I know this feature from other apps like telegram and always thought it was quite useful.

Yes it’s a handy feature especially if your in a big group u can now pin messages for 24 hours , 7 days or 30 days in WhatsApp

Seems that the signal devs are well behind in terms of implementation of new features when you compare to WhatsApp etc

I’d love to see this implemented, but just want to point out that it’s related to:

Bookmarks / favorites / starred / pinned messages Feature Requests
Add a feature that lets users favorite messages and save them into a list that they can check later on. It’s fundamental when you wanna find special moments /memories / pictures and stuff.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: This FR you’ve linked seems to try to cover to many things at a time. It also does not seem to refer to what this post is talking about.

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked: I dont think so, since this thread to me seems to be about packing messages in different lists and tbh its quite hard to get around what exactly they want in this feature.

posts.name: Jeffrey
posts.cooked:
Duplicate of this feature.

Bookmarks / favorites / starred / pinned messages Feature Requests
Add a feature that lets users favorite messages and save them into a list that they can check later on. It’s fundamental when you wanna find special moments /memories / pictures and stuff.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: It is not a dupe as mentioned for the reasons above. A feature request using the same words does not result in the same feature request if the explanation of the feature is different.
Granted, but some thoughts about pinning posts within a conversation have been dropped there as well, so I justed wanted to reference it. We certainly shouldn’t delete this topic.

posts.name: Fabian
posts.cooked:
I will edit this post later on today and add an image of how it is done in telegram to make things more clear.

Edit: Original post is edited and the image added, I hope this makes it clearer for everybody.

posts.name: Volker M.
posts.cooked:
We are currently experiencing the underlying problem in a chat group with around a dozen members:
When a discussion emerges, you can’t easily traverse the tree of answers (this is partially addressed by the “view answers” speechbubble button, a full solution would require threading).

But, most important, it becomes hard to identify/locate (by scrolling) any important messages lurking between all those answers. This imho must be addressed somehow. If there are no collapsible threads, pinning would be my favorite solution. By default, only admins should be able to pin/unpin. And multiple pinned postings should be feasible.

Secondary to me is how the pinned posts can be reached. At the top is common practice, but consumes more space than alternatives, like putting/highlighting them at the end (so one can scroll up beyond them) either as short excerpts (like in replies now) or icons that expand or jump to the pinned postings.

Thanks to the Signal devs for their great tool – and for considering this change request.

link_counts.title: True threading / channels / subgroups / rooms / threads like Slack in Signal

posts.name: Keith Ludwig
posts.cooked:
Just adding my vote for having such a feature. In group chats, newly added members can’t see prior messages (for security/privacy reasons I’m assuming). But there needs to be a way to let them see SOME information relevant to the group and what it’s discussing.

One way is to allow messages to be pinned. If a group chat admin decides to pin a message, it’s with the express intent that it remain visible and available to new members.

An alternative solution might be to allow a summary or overview page for each group chat that allows common information to be accessible to everyone. There is already a spot for a group description, maybe this could be expanded into a whole page that’s easily accessed by chat members?

Your Signal clients do not synchronize chats with a server the way Discord, Slack, Teams, or Matrix does. If pinned messages comes to Signal, each person would need to pin the same message. The messages reside on individual devices. Each person can delete the message from the device, so there is no way to have a common pinned message for everyone in the chat. New members would not see a previously sent message, thus could not pin it.

Keith_Ludwig:

An alternative solution might be to allow a summary or overview page for each group chat that allows common information to be accessible to everyone. There is already a spot for a group description, maybe this could be expanded into a whole page that’s easily accessed by chat members?

I think that this is a good idea and should become its own feature request if it is not already.

fancy_title: Pin a message to top of chat
title: Pin a message to top of chat

accepted_answer.name: Salt
accepted_answer.excerpt:
Signal Messenger

Put a pin in it

Your most frequently asked questions, dinner reservations, and vacation itineraries are already top of mind. Now they can be top of chat as well. In the latest version of Signal rolling out now, you can pin your most important messages to the top of...
